Message.Title: Microsoft can't tap into the fast-growing tablet market - Disappointing Windows 8 sales
Message.Msg: Microsoft can't tap into the fast-growing tablet market, according to new figures that reveal lacklustre sales of Surface RT and other Windows 8 slabs. Canalys figures for Q4 show a 12 per cent growth in the worldwide PC market, fuelled by a 75 per cent rise in tab shipments to 46.2 million units. Notebooks sales were flat (58 million), desktops declined 5 per cent (28 million) and netbooks took their last gasps of breath. More Reading APAC PC shipments FALL for first time ever in 2012 New stats: Blighty's PC market ended 2012 on its KNEES HP still top of PC league, but trailing fourth in all-devices rankings Yet Microsoft wasn't able to seize a big slice of the action - only 1.6 million Windows-based tabs were bought by customers - including 722,000 Surface RT devices. This represents a tab market share of 3.4 per cent. "Windows 8 launched late in the year and was a massive departure from the existing operating systems, so consumers played a wait-and-see game," said Tim Coulling, senior analyst at Canalys. Disappointing Windows 8 sales

Message.Msg: Email and texting arrived, you know that. They have to deliver at every address in the USA every day, mind boggling how they do it really. Maybe they need to go to a demand basis like UPS and Fedex. That's a big change to a great country, not to have a mail service. They do a very good job, better than UPS or Fedex I think. Many documents still need to be mailed, maybe we should see if UPS would take 46 cents to deliver a piece of paper to me. I have no problem with subsidizing the post office, we are still a developed country. Yes, probably was before Obama. Times will get better, bringing manufacturing back, and people becoming more aware it isn't all about their own wealth that matters. We will come back, even better, with a post office too. Topic.Title: Remember: Sequestration/Fiscal Cliff Plan Came from Obama

Message.Msg: The Congressional Business Office reported that our federal deficit will fall below $1 trillion for 2013 because of the $85 billion in mandatory sequestration cuts scheduled to begin in March. The CBO also predicted that because of the $85 billion in spending cuts, the GNP and other economic growth indicators will continue to fall in 2013. This panicked the Obama White House. The 2012 Fourth Quarter GNP dropped to -0.1%. If the GNP goes negative again for the First Quarter of 2013, we will officially be in an Obama Recession. Obama immediately held a press conference. However, the fearful and agitated Obama would not take any questions from the news media. Obama also would not comment on why for the fourth consecutive year he has not presented his budget proposal in a timely manner. Obama’s Sequester, originally intended to intimidate and divide the Republicans, has come back to bite Obama hard. Obama is panicked and in deepening trouble, as his redistribution economics continue to push us to ever greater economic disasters

Message.Title: Windows Phone 8 hasn't slowed Microsoft's mobile freefall
Message.Msg: On the Register.... =============================== Four months after its formal launch, not only has Windows Phone 8 failed to win Microsoft a bigger piece of the mobile pie, but Redmond's share of US smartphone subscribers is actually still shrinking, according to the latest figures from analytics firm comScore. You may recall that last November CEO Steve Ballmer was crowing about what a success the Windows Phone 8 launch had been, and that Microsoft was selling four times as many Windows Phone devices as it had during November 2011. But as we all know, four times nothing is still nothing, and based on the current numbers, it looks like sales of devices running Microsoft's latest mobile OS have hardly been anything to phone home about. The data released on Wednesday shows Microsoft's platform accounting for a measly 3.6 per cent share of smartphone subscriptions during the three months ending September 2012, just before the first Windows Phone 8 devices were due to ship. You might have expected to see a sales spike once Microsoft's WinPhone hype machine kicked into full gear. But by the end of December 2012 – well after the Phone 8 launch, not to mention the holiday shopping season – Redmond's share had dropped even further, down to 2.9 per cent. ===============================

Message.Msg: Thanks for proving my point about birther skeeters, have fun talking about it amongst yourselves. "What ifs" and "whys" abound, and new conspiracies are born daily. How that makes the day go by when you have no work to do. The President didn't lie. He just doesn't lie, period, most honest guy he is. I know when yiou grew up you were taught to think otherwise on these things, and you aren't going to change. It's nighty nite time, you have a new Barista date tomorrow. What time? You never answer what time.

Topic.Title: More Americans convinced of the reality of climate change.

Message.Msg: Stupid is what stupid does!

Topic.Title: This morning the Barista tried to get me to try a new blend

Message.Msg: Yah, fake skeet shooting is always "taken" from the side, yah that's it. If it's real skeet shooting, it is always "taken" from behind and shows the broken skeets too, yah that's right. There's only one picture, why not more? Yah, why not more, one means it's a photo op to prove the lie was true. Yah that's it. Obama didn't know better and those around him too, yah that's it, gottem now.. Proves it wasn't true and he lied, yah. There's your facts and proof. Only I haveta say if it was "taken" from behind, we would say it isn't him but a look alike from behind. Then it would still be fake skeet shooting, even if "taken" from behind. Here we are in 2013, the terrorists are trying to kill us, north korea is shooting missles, iran is sending rockets up, people are shooting children anywhere, and we talk about if it's fake or real skeet shooting at Camp david from studying a picture all day.

Message.Title: Einhorn shakes cash hoard loose from AAPL, and stock jumps 3%
Message.Msg: "Cash-rich technology giant Apple (AAPL) needs to find a way to distribute its cash to shareholders, instead of sticking to the Depression-like mentality that prompts the company to hoard equity, fund manager David Einhorn told CNBC on Thursday." After Einhorn's comments about AAPL cash, the stock jumped 3% after hours. Like AAPL, MSFT has a cash hoarding problem. Wonder what tomorrow will bring.....
